trustfund:
TF022215-CANADIAN GENERAL CTF II-SOUTH AMERICA,TF035703-BOLIVIA - HYDROCARBONS SECTOR
            REFORM AND CAPITALIZATION PROJECT,TF034374-BOLIVIA - HYDROCARBONS SEC.
            REFORM & CAPITALIZATION PROJECT,TF033847-BOLIVIA - ENERGY, POWER,TF022916-HYDROCARBON SECTOR DEREGULATION

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was highly
            satisfactory: the project achieved its key objectives and 1)
            established a regulatory framework that not only helped in
            implementing the capitalization program but provided the
            state with the capability to properly regulate the
            capitalized enterprises in the future; developed an
            accountability mechanism and a legal framework guaranteeing
            the rights of all relevant parties; and 3) maximized the
            value of the Bolivian's share in key petroleum sector
            entities before and after capitalization, among other
            objectives. Project sustainability is highly likely.
            Similarly, both World Bank and Borrower performances were
            highly satisfactory. Key lessons learned were: Quality staff
            with a clear mandate, sufficient autonomy, and authority is
            critical to implementing reform programs, particularly
            privatization of state-owned enterprises. To succeed, the
            reforms have to be not only economically but also
            politically sustainable. The privatization process should be
            transparent with continuous education of the public. For
            privatization to lead to greater competition, the regulatory
            framework must be transparent prior to the divestiture
            process. Bolivia's capitalization process where the
            capitalization's sales money is invested in the
            enterprise might be worth duplicating in other countries.
